movies.title: Weaverfish
movies.plot: After spending the night partying at a condemned river creek, the atmosphere is soon lost for quiet teenager Reece and his friends. Headaches and heartaches give way to a terrifying race back to civilisation as a grossly disfiguring virus takes hold on the most vulnerable.
movies.simplePlot: After spending the night partying at a condemned river creek, the atmosphere is soon lost for quiet teenager Reece and his friends. Headaches and heartaches give way to a terrifying race back to civilisation as a grossly disfiguring virus takes hold on the most vulnerable.

biography.bio: Shane O'Meara came to prominence playing troubled Scots schoolboy Connor Mulgrew, at odds with his alcoholic mother, in the long running television series 'Waterloo Road' though he was not Scottish and rather too old for school having been born in Ireland on April 26 1992 and having two brothers Allen and Ryan and a sister Sionainn. When Shane was seven the family did move to Livingstone, Scotland where he went to school and from there he went on to study High Drama and Acting at Edinburgh Telford College and Dundee College, graduating in 2011. Other than a role in the short film 'Weaverfish', made in Fife, 'Waterloo Road' was his first significant part and in 2015 he joined the cast of Midlands-based soap 'Doctors', reverting perfectly back to his native Irish accent. Shane is 5'11"
biography.name: Shane O'Meara

biography.bio: Lucy-Jane Quinlan is an actress and writer, known for Cage (2016), Where Do We Go From Here? (2015) and The Cutting Room (2015).
biography.name: Lucy-Jane Quinlan

biography.bio: Josh Ockenden is a British-Australian actor, who spent his early years growing up in the Canary Islands, Malaysia and Brisbane, Australia. After high school Josh trained in theatre on the Y.A.S. program with NIDA (National Institute of Dramatic Arts), before moving to study in L.A. in 2010. He has worked on several T.V. projects including The Digger: A History for the History Channel and feature films including Weaverfish and Through the Lens. Josh is now based in the U.K. He has qualified with the BADC (British Acadamy Dramatic Combat) to an Advanced level and specialised in varied weapon systems including longsword, 18th century french small sword and axe & shield.
biography.name: Josh Ockenden

biography.bio: Jessie Morell is an actress, known for Weaverfish (2013), Alan Partridge on Open Books with Martin Bryce (2012) and A Touch of Cloth (2012).
biography.name: Jessie Morell

biography.name: Ripeka Templeton

biography.bio: Born in Nassau, The Bahamas March 30th 1984. Duncan Casey is the son of Zoe Brading and Philip Casey MBE. His Grandfather, Ray Nathaniels was an architect who designed and built houses in The Bahamas for (among others) Sydney Poitier. Duncan developed a love of acting at age 10 while at primary school in Cambridge, England. He performed in countless plays during his teens. He began taking classes in film acting in 2009 and in 2010 went on to perform in 15 independent movies.
biography.name: Duncan Casey
